definitions.definition: having a low rank in an organization or a profession

examples.text: He's quite junior in the organization.

definitions.definition: connected with young people below a particular age, rather than with adults, especially in sports

examples.text: He's a member of the club's **junior team**.

definitions.definition: (especially in the US) used after the name of a man who has the same name as his father, to make it clear who is being referred to
for children under the age of 11 or 13

examples.text: the junior section of the school

definitions.definition: connected with the year before the last year in a high school or college

examples.text: I spent my junior year in France.

wordOrigin: Middle English (as an adjective following a family name): from Latin, comparative of juvenis ‘young’.
